FOR the last 40 years, Karen E. Gersch, artist and acrobat, has traveled the world chronicling her love of circuses in oil paintings, watercolors, quick line sketches and pastels. She is a Russian-trained performer herself and a founder of the Big Apple Circus.

Her circus art, including the aerialist shown at left, is going on display this month at the Waterfront Museum, on a 1914 Lehigh Valley railroad barge. It can be seen during the museum's own series of circus performances this afternoon and the next three Sundays in June. Ms. Gersch will also meet the public at an open house on June 17.

''Jugglers: Caught in the Act,'' art by Karen E. Gersch; the Waterfront Museum, 290 Conover Street, Pier 45, Red Hook, Brooklyn; open house June 17, 4:30 p.m. until sunset; circus performances 2 p.m. and 4 p.m. today, next Sunday, June 18 and 25, ; ringside reservations $5 or seating free at showtime; (718) 624-4719.
